author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday completed a whirlwind trip to the Middle East to tout what he called an “historic dawn of a new Middle East” and formally sign a peace deal to end the fighting in Gaza between Israel and Hamas. The trip was something of a victory lap for Trump, who basked in applause…
title: 5 takeaways from Trump’s trip to mark Gaza peace deal

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Singer-songwriter John Legend says President Trump will need to stop the “dictator s‑‑‑” if he wants to win the Nobel Peace Prize next year. In a video posted to Instagram on Sunday, the award-winning artist addressed the president, who has openly sought the Nobel, saying he would try “positive reinforcement” to get Trump to change…
title: John Legend advises Trump to drop the ‘dictator s‑‑‑’ if he wants Nobel Peace Prize

description: President Trump is in Egypt on Monday, meeting with its president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, in the coastal resort area of Sharm-el-Sheik where world leaders are expected to sign a peace agreement as a next step in ending the war in Gaza. Earlier Monday, Trump addressed the Knesset, Israel’s parliament, where he urged Israeli leaders to…
title: Live updates: Trump arrives in Egypt to tout Middle East peal deal

author: Max Rego
description: Former President Obama criticized law firms, universities and businesses that have changed course during the Trump administration, saying they should stand by their convictions. During a episode of the WTF podcast with Marc Maron released Monday, Obama said institutions should “take a stand” and uphold the law, preserve academic freedom and value diversity. Obama said…
title: Obama knocks law firms, businesses that have made deals with Trump

author: Rep. Nicole Malliotakis (R-N.Y.), Rep. Judy Chu (D-Calif.) and Jon Voight, opinion contributors
description: Section 181, the federal tax incentive designed to keep film and television production in the U.S., is set to expire at the end of the year, and a bipartisan effort is underway to extend and strengthen it to protect American jobs, businesses, and communities.
title: Pass the CREATE Act, keep the US entertainment industry competitive

author: Melanie DaSilva
description: Crews responded Monday morning to a plane crash on I-195 in Dartmouth, Massachusetts.
title: Plane crashes on Massachusetts interstate

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Monday that the government shutdown is starting to affect the U.S. economy. During an interview on Fox Business Network’s “Mornings with Maria,” Bessent said the media is not sufficiently covering the gravity of the shutdown, now in its thirteenth day. “I think the dirty secret here for why this…
title: Shutdown starting to affect US economy: Bessent

author: Lee Ann Anderson
description: Attorney General Pam Bondi appears to be giving a good review to a “Saturday Night Live” skit in which Amy Poehler mocked her appearance before a Senate committee last week. “Should we recreate this picture in Chicago? Loving Amy Poehler!” Bondi wrote in a post on X that tagged for Secretary of Homeland Security Kristi…
title: Bondi on ‘SNL’ portrayal: ‘Loving Amy Poehler!’

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: A minor MAGA Republican uproar over news last week that the U.S. would host Qatari pilots at a U.S. military base in Idaho was not caused by the Pentagon’s misleading phrasing for the facility, rather, a “misreporting” on the facts, according to Vice President Vance. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth on Friday said that the U.S.…
title: Vance blames ‘misreporting’ for uproar after Hegseth Qatari air force facility announcement

description: President Trump traveled to Sharm El Sheikh, Egypt on Monday to participate in a Mideast peace ceremony. Trump earlier Monday addressed the Knesset in Israel as he visited the Middle East to mark the beginning of a peace accord to end the fighting in Gaza. Trump spoke for more than an hour in Jerusalem as celebrations took…
title: Watch live: Trump participates in Mideast peace ceremony

author: Douglas Schoen and Carly Cooperman, opinion contributors
description: While there has been much coverage regarding Americans’ decline in support for Israel and anti-Israel bias, the data simply does not corroborate that.
title: Polls show Americans aren’t souring on Israel nearly as much as the media suggest

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday urged Israeli leaders to turn the page from warfare to peace, telling the Knesset that Israel had won “all that they can by force of arms” and expressing optimism about the region’s future. Trump addressed the Israeli Parliament during a visit to the Middle East to mark the release of hostages and…
title: Trump to Knesset: Israel has won ‘all that they can’ in military campaign

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Vice President Vance warned on Sunday that cuts to the federal workforce will only get “deeper” as the government shutdown drags on. In an interview on Fox News’s “Sunday Morning Futures,” host Maria Bartiromo asked the vice president about President Trump describing the moment as an “opportunity” and about how significant the cuts would be.…
title: Vance: ‘Deeper’ cuts ahead for federal workers

author: William S. Becker, opinion contributor
description: Fossil-energy companies are determined to avoid their share of responsibility.
title: Shouldn’t polluters, not taxpayers, pay for disaster assistance?

author: The Associated Press
description: A nor’easter churned its way up the East Coast on Sunday, washing out roads and prompting air travel delays as heavily populated areas of the Northeast braced for excessive rain, lashing winds and coastal flooding.
title: Nor’easter prompts New Jersey state of emergency, coastal flooding

author: Laura Kelly
description: President Trump’s speech at Israel’s Knesset, its parliament, was briefly interrupted by lawmakers who were expelled from the plenum after shouting slogans during Trump’s remarks. The Jerusalem Post identified those protesting as Ayman Odeh, an Arab Israeli and member of the Hadash alliance and Ofer Cassif, a far-left politician who is also a member of…
title: Lawmakers ejected from Knesset after disrupting Trump speech

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: China called on President Trump to withdraw his latest tariff threat, warning that Beijing is prepared to retaliate if the U.S. president follows through with 100 percent tariffs. In a press conference Monday, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Lin Jian was asked how China will respond to the tariff threat, which Trump made in response to…
title: China calls on Trump to withdraw latest tariff threat

author: Robert Wilkie, opinion contributor
description: The Trump administration and Congress are working to restore the military's ability to repair its own equipment, which would save taxpayers billions and protect American lives.
title: Our troops deserve the right to repair

description: President Trump on Monday morning will speak at the Knesset, Israel’s parliament, in the wake of Hamas releasing the last living hostages from Gaza. Trump is making the trip to the Middle East as a deal is being implemented to end the fighting in Gaza after two years of war. Watch Trump’s remarks, expected to…
title: Watch: Trump addresses Israel’s Knesset

author: Daniel Allott, opinion contributor
description: Over the last four years, nearly 20 percent of Cuba's population has fled.
title: Venezuela is collapsing — and don’t look now, but so is Cuba

author: Jared Gans
description: Today: Hostages released, Trump addresses Knesset, mass layoffs begin, Virginia Dems support Spanberger, New Orleans picks new leader.
title: Hostages released as Trump peace plan starts

author: Emily Brooks
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) insists she hasn’t changed, but the conservative firebrand’s deepening splits with her party on everything from Jeffrey Epstein to health care subsidies are puzzling and exasperating her fellow Republicans. Greene forged her political identity in Congress as a fierce Trump loyalist, defending the president and Jan. 6, 2021, protesters, and…
title: Greene’s deepening split with GOP leaves Republicans exasperated

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Four years ago, Virginia Gov. Glenn Youngkin (R) was able to ride education and parents’ rights as campaign issues straight to victory. But current Republican nominee Lt. Gov. Winsome Earle-Sears isn’t getting the same traction.   Earle-Sears has positioned transgender Virginians in women’s locker rooms and on women’s sports teams in schools as a top issue,…
title: In Virginia, Youngkin rode education to victory 4 years ago. Earle-Sears struggles to replicate his success

author: Surina Venkat
description: State lawmakers have taken up President Trump’s aggressive push to expand the use of the death penalty, setting up legislative and legal battles that could make a wider range of crimes subject to capital punishment.  In September alone, 15 states sought the federal government’s support in their quest to increase the death penalty’s scope outside…
title: Trump’s death penalty push gains traction in statehouses

author: Brett Samuels
description: Hamas on Monday released all 20 living hostages still being held since the October, 2023 attacks in Israel, marking a major milestone in the first phase of a Middle East peace deal to end the fighting in Gaza. Israeli officials confirmed that Hamas had transferred all 20 remaining hostages to the custody of the Red…
title: Hamas releases remaining 20 living Israeli hostages
